context.content: "Catch Me If You Can" is a 2002 biographical crime film directed by Steven Spielberg. It's based on the true story of Frank Abagnale, Jr., who successfully performed cons worth millions of dollars by posing as a Pan American World Airways pilot, a Georgia doctor, and a Louisiana parish prosecutor. The film explores his cat-and-mouse game with FBI agent Carl Hanratty as well as the emotional impact of his actions on his family. It stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks in the lead roles.
